item.title: Exploring film simulations
item.description: In the prime days of analog photography, some photographic fims earned a legendary status. FujiChrome Velvia and Astia from Fujifilm, or Kodachrome from Kodak became big names. As a kid discovering photography as a hobby, I may have only had Agfa Vista and Kodak Gold to choose from at the local photo lab, but I sure did read about the others. Now that we are into the era of smartphone photography, and digital cameras are often associated with vlogging, I think Fujifilm does an outstanding job marketing-wise by advertising "film simulation modes": color profiles that are applied directly by the camera to jpeg images.
